title: Ticket #3652: fix condor-procd dependency on the rest of condor
description:
The condor-procd sub-package was intended to be a stand-alone, but the dependencies are such that installing condor-procd (with yum) pulls in the rest of condor. Apparently this is due to it requiring the libcondor_utils shared lib.

Look into the specifics of why this happens and if possible fix the dependencies so it can stand alone.
remarks:
2013-May-21 18:19:17 by edquist:
The main issue seems to be that condor-procd uses libcondor_utils_%{version}.so, which is part of the main condor package. Maybe we can put that library into its own sub-package? (something like condor-libs?)

Additionally, condor-procd uses libclassad.so.3, which is part of condor-classads. This is less of a big deal, since condor-classads can stand alone, but we should probably add the dependency explicitly to require condor-classads instead of implicitly with the autoreqs.

Attaching a dependency graph for the condor-* packages/libs.

2013-May-21 19:45:02 by edquist:
Actually it looks like this is fixed in 7.9.6 (#1986)
